Package de.ikor.sip.foundation.core.actuator.health.ftp

Class FtpHealthIndicators

java.lang.Object
de.ikor.sip.foundation.core.actuator.health.ftp.FtpHealthIndicators
public class FtpHealthIndicators extends Object
Class FtpHealthIndicators provides a set of utility functions that can perform operations on remote FTP servers to check if they are healthy.

The criteria of healthy can vary: is it the ability to list files from a directory on a remote server, or we simply want to be able to execute the NOOP FTP request (the default health indicator).

    • noopHealthIndicator

      public static org.springframework.boot.actuate.health.Health noopHealthIndicator(org.apache.camel.Endpoint endpoint)
      Executes the FTP NOOP request to check if the remote FTP server is healthy.
      Parameters:
      endpoint - Remote FTP endpoint
      Returns:
      Health status based on application ability to execute FTP NOOP request against the remote server

    • listDirHealthIndicator

      public static org.springframework.boot.actuate.health.Health listDirHealthIndicator(org.apache.camel.Endpoint endpoint)
      Lists folder from defined in endpoint URI as a health check operation. If folder listing completes with no error, endpoint is considered healthy.
      Parameters:
      endpoint - Remote FTP endpoint
      Returns:
      Health status based on application ability to execute FTP listDir request against the remote server

    • ftpHealthIndicator

      public static Function<org.apache.camel.Endpoint,org.springframework.boot.actuate.health.Health> ftpHealthIndicator(BiConsumer<org.apache.camel.component.file.remote.RemoteFileEndpoint<?>,org.apache.camel.component.file.remote.RemoteFileOperations<?>> healthCheck)
      A factory for health indicator functions that gives the possibility to define a custom health check and use it in the SIP health checking framework.
      Parameters:
      healthCheck - A function implementing criteria for "healthy"
      Returns:
      Returns a health indicator: function that evaluates if an endpoint is healthy
